skill.name: blocklet-converter
skill.description: Converts static web or Next.js projects into ArcBlock blocklets using provided DID. Analyzes project structure, generates configuration files, and validates setup. Requires blocklet DID as parameter.
skill.summary: Converts web projects into ArcBlock blocklets with automated setup and validation
skill.author: ArcBlock

security_audit.summary: This skill is safe for publication. The 125 static findings are false positives from template files and documentation examples. The skill executes legitimate build commands for converting web projects to blocklets. No malicious patterns, data exfiltration, or unauthorized network access detected.

low_findings.title: Template Files Contain Placeholder Code
low_findings.description: Static analysis flagged code patterns in template files and documentation examples. These are legitimate template placeholders for Next.js server configuration and YAML templates that will be copied to user projects. The skill does not execute malicious code.

content.user_title: Convert Web Projects to ArcBlock Blocklets
content.value_statement: Manual blocklet configuration is time consuming and error prone. This skill automates the entire conversion process for static web and Next.js projects into ArcBlock blocklets with validation.
actual_capabilities: Detect project type automatically from package.json dependencies
Generate blocklet.yml configuration files with proper DID and metadata
Install dependencies and run build processes for web projects
Create missing README and logo assets using default templates
Validate blocklet configuration and create release bundles
Support both static webapps and Next.js server-side applications
limitations: Requires pre-generated blocklet DID in correct format
Only supports static webapps and Next.js projects, not backend frameworks
Requires blocklet CLI to be installed on the system
Build failures will halt the conversion process immediately

best_practices: Always provide a valid blocklet DID starting with z8ia or z2qa format
Ensure your project has a package.json with proper dependencies before conversion
Run the conversion in a clean git repository to track changes made by the skill
anti_patterns: Do not attempt to convert backend API projects, only static and Next.js apps are supported
Do not skip the DID parameter, the skill requires it upfront and will exit immediately
Do not ignore build failures, fix TypeScript and configuration errors before retrying

faq.question: What is a blocklet DID and how do I get one?
faq.answer: A DID is a decentralized identifier for your blocklet. Generate one using the command: blocklet create --did-only --random

faq.question: Can I convert Express or Fastify backend apps?
faq.answer: No, this skill only supports static webapps and Next.js projects. Backend framework projects will be rejected with an error message.

faq.question: What happens if my build fails during conversion?
faq.answer: The skill will exit immediately and display the build error output. Fix the errors and run the conversion again.

faq.question: Do I need to install any tools before using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you need the blocklet CLI installed globally. Install it with: npm install -g @blocklet/cli

faq.question: Where does the skill look for my built files?
faq.answer: For static sites it checks dist, build, out, public directories. For Next.js it always uses the .next directory.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated blocklet.yml file?
faq.answer: Yes, after the skill generates the file you can edit it manually to add custom configurations, environments, or capabilities.
